alert.note: Alert for Burke (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 04 at 1:21AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Burke County in western North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 515 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 111 AM EST, The stream gauge on the Johns River reported a water level of 8.6 feet and rising. Minor flooding has developed due to the recent rainfall of 1 to 2 inches over the past 12 hours. No additional rainfall is expected this morning, but additional rises are likely as the water channels downstream from heavier rainfall in and near the mountains. - Flooding will develop along Johns River Road near the gauge site. Flooding is also possible in the boat ramp parking lot on Corpening Bridge Road. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
